question_details.query: What is the most cost-effective way to control problematic plants on peatlands?

summary_details.relevant_summary: One study found that using herbicide to control shrubs in fens, along with other interventions, led to changes in the overall plant community composition but could not prevent increases in shrub cover over time [1776]. It also prevented increases in plant species richness [1776]. No studies were found that evaluated the effects of using covers or barriers to control problematic plants on peatland vegetation [1775], or of physically damaging problematic plants [1769].
summary_statements: A study found that using herbicide to control shrubs in fens, along with other interventions, led to changes in the overall plant community composition.
A study found that using herbicide to control shrubs in fens, along with other interventions, could not prevent increases in shrub cover over time.
Using herbicide to control shrubs in fens, along with other interventions, also prevented increases in plant species richness.
No studies were found that evaluated the effects of using covers or barriers to control problematic plants on peatland vegetation.
No studies were found that evaluated the effects of physically damaging problematic plants.
